Name.label: Severe combined immunodeficiency due to CTPS1 deficiency

TextSection.Contents: Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) due to CTPS1 deficiency is a rare primary immunodeficiency disorder due to impaired capacity of activated T- and B-cells to proliferate in response to antigen receptor-mediated activation characterized by early-onset, severe, persistent and/or recurrent viral infections due to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) and Varicella Zoster virus (VZV, including generalized varicella)), as well as recurrent sino-pulmonary bacterial infections due to encapsulated pathogens.
